poem:
**A July Dissolution**

Under restless skies, history turns,
Powers shift, a Nation yearns.
Four prime ministers, faces worn—
Promises on winds forlorn.

Labour tipped, the Tories fade,
Votes delayed, democracy swayed.
A July gamble, fate aligns,
Dogs bark, the future grinds.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Final pleas, postal vote delays and dogs: British voters go to the polls Under bright, blustery skies across most of the UK, British voters went to the polls on Thursday to elect their fourth prime minister in five years, with Keir Starmer’s Labour party heavily tipped to win an overwhelming parliamentary majority and bring to an end 14 years of Conservative-led government. After weeks of campaigning after Rishi Sunak’s surprise gamble to call a July". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
